# General instructions

Exam 03 will be released on Thu, Nov 18 at 9am and must be completed by Fri, Nov 19 at 11:59pm. You will find the **exam-03-** repo on GitHub by Thursday at 9am. 

The exam will consist of two parts: 

`r emo::ji("one")` Multiple choice/ short answer questions on Sakai test and quizzes. This portion may only be submitted one time.
  

`r emo::ji("two")` Data analysis in RStudio and submitted in Gradescope (like a usual lab and homework)

- You must submit a PDF document to Gradescope that corresponds to an`.Rmd` file on your GitHub repository in order to receive credit for this portion of the exam.

**Both portions must be completed and submitted by Fri, Nov 19 at 11:59pm**. Late work will only be accepted in the case of of extenuating circumstances and notification from your academic dean.

# Rules & Notes

-   This is an individual assignment. Everything in your repository is for your eyes only.
-   You may not collaborate or communicate anything about this exam to **anyone** except the instructor. For example, you may not communicate with other students, the TAs, or post/solicit help on the internet, email or via any other method of communication.
- The exam is open-book, open-note, so you may use any materials from class as you take the exam.
- No TA office hours will be held during the exam.
- You may not email the TAs questions about the exam.
- Ed Discussion will be inactive during the exam.
- If you have questions, email Professor Tackett with  "STA 210 Exam" in the subject line or attend Professor Tackett's office hours. 

# Submission

`r emo::ji("white_check_mark")` The answers to the multiple choice/short answer questions should be submitted under *Test & Quizzes* in Sakai (same place you take prep quizzes)

`r emo::ji("white_check_mark")` The PDF document for the data analysis portion must be uploaded to Gradescope. 

- Mark the pages associated with each section. If
any answer for a section spans multiple pages, mark all pages.
